sentence.text: Ring finger protein 6 (protein K27-linked ubiquitination) is a key oncogene in both prostate cancer and leukemia, but its role is elusive in breast cancer.
In the present study, we found that protein K27-linked ubiquitination was overexpressed in more than 70% of breast cancer tissues and it was associated with overall survival.
protein K27-linked ubiquitination increased breast cancer cell proliferation, migration and reduced cell sensitivity to doxorubicin.
Further studies showed that protein K27-linked ubiquitination was closely associated with increased expression of estrogen receptor, a critical factor in the development of breast cancers.

In doxorubicin-resistant breast cancer cells, protein K27-linked ubiquitination was found to be elevated in association with increased ERa and anti-apoptotic release of cytochrome c from mitochondria, but not pro-apoptotic intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to DNA damage-1.

entity.text: release of cytochrome c from mitochondria
intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to DNA damage

sentence.text: Therefore, this study demonstrated that there exists an protein K27-linked ubiquitination/ERa/release of cytochrome c from mitochondria axle in breast cancer which promotes cancer cell proliferation and survival.

entity.text: release of cytochrome c from mitochondria
